body.p: I am deeply impressed with, the Shamefully helpless situation in which, the last legislature has left the State of Kentucky -- with a reputation for shivalry and efficiency in war unsurpassed by by an State She now stands like a fettered giant -- the sport and of all around us -- You have discharged your whole duty I admit; but utter no remedy^s^, -- can the people not do what their faithless representatives have failed to do^s^, -- It has occurred to that efficient men in each County might raise by subscription or other contribution, the necessary funds to buy arms & ammunition --
We want nothing but arms and ammunition and I will vouch for the balance,
I merely make the suggestion, your better acquaintance with the sentiments and feelings of the people throughout the state will enable you to Judge as to the practicability of the idea --
I fear verry much that under the Existing state of things we could not procure the arms even if we had the funds --
If your engagements will allow I should be glad to have your views on the whole subject -- we should be armed whether we stand by the Union or go with the south
